metadata.Title: CVE-2017-9736 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description: SPIP 3.1.x before 3.1.6 and 3.2.x before Beta 3 does not remove shell metacharacters from the host field, allowing a remote attacker to cause remote code execution.

notes.Note: seth-arnold> The patches look like this is a simple black-list functionality but doesn't black-list $() or `` or <() or any other number of shell metacharacters. I expect this is still broken and should use a whitelist of a-z0-9_-. msalvatore> "SPIP 3.0.x and earlier versions are not affected by this issue."

criterions.comment: spip: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
